definition: introspection/to ask oneself
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
body/oneself/personally/to bow
old variant of 躬[gong1]
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to ask

sentences.english: What does Jesus Christ mean to you today?
sentences.chinese: 请反躬自问，耶稣基督在今天对你又有何意义呢？

sentences.english: I searched my heart if I had been unfair in criticizing John only.
sentences.chinese: 我反躬自问，只批评约翰一个人是否有失公平。

definition: to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
to examine/to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)
to demand perfection (idiom)
to ask questions/to interrogate
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to accept criticism gladly (humble expr.)/to be happy when one's errors are pointed out
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3

definition: What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

self-criticism
